website_summaries.verdict: A great classic-style hiking shoe with all the features you'd want for the trails.
pros: The Ventilator features a thick protective outsole and plenty of support for long hikes or trail outings
The fit is comfortable and the shoe is well-constructed
The upper dries quickly and the outsole provides good traction on all types of terrain
cons: Heavy and may not provide enough cushioning for all

customer_reviews.title: Sole Separates From the Heel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoes for my wife and the soles separated from the fabric after one, 8 mile hike. I thought Merrell was a good brand but apparently I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amatron

customer_reviews.title: True to size with a wonderful roomy toe box
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 7.5 and my feet are a little bit on the wider side. I normally wear Keen's but wanted to give Merrell a try since I really liked the taupe color. I ordered half a size up according to some reviews but they were way too big so I exchanged them for my regular size 7.5. That said, this hiking shoe is true to size BUT with a wonderful roomy toe box. It's well made, very light and I love the removable insole with great arch support. So far I only wore them on a regular/moderate hike but I'm looking forward to try them out on a more strenuous hike.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: I hiked the 500 mile Camino with no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I used these hiking shoes to hike the 500 mile Camino in Spain. I did all 500 miles, with special inserts by my doctor, in these hiking shoes with no blisters or problems whatsoever. I hiked through rain, mud, sleet, hail, snow and blizzard conditions over mountains or on sidewalks and had no problems with it gripping the ground. I did get them a little bigger then my regular shoe size to allow for my feet swelling when I am hiking so many miles. I would use them again if I hiked another 500 mile Camino de Santiago.
customer_reviews.author: Review2856

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than a year ago
customer_reviews.text: I bought the exact same pair in a different color ('Sand') last spring, and they fit perfectly right out of the box. This pair was roughly an inch shorter and I couldn't even cram my feet into them. Not sure what is going on with their manufacturing, because I've always been a Merrell fan. So I am trying my luck with a Moab Ventilator in Men's size 9. Photo is of my new pair (left) and my pair from a year ago (right), both size 10 M US. Updating from 2 to 3 stars because it's still a good shoe, but this inconsistency in sizing is pretty terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: It was used for a 10-day backpacking trip in southern California, no rain, just heat and dry, rocky conditions. Came home with tons of blisters and the shoes were not in any condition to be used again. I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Shanti

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Man, I wore Moab Ventilators for years and loved them both as a casual hiking and street shoe, but this pair feels like I'm wearing a rock on both feet. There is zero cushioning in the sole. I tried adding my SuperFeet inserts to no avail; these make my feet/arches hurt after less than a mile of strolling around. Not sure if this was just an old pair (something to watch for--apparently the material used for the soles does wear out/provide less cushioning over time) but I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: yogadog1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the Merrell Moab Ventilator Hiking Shoe, a perfect fit for my size-6 duck feet -- roomy toe box, narrow heels. These Ventilators perform well on my daily mountain hikes, not missing a beat over five or more miles. I wanted to order the Sand color (kind of a pink and purple), but couldn't justify the extra $50 just to be trendy. The Taupe is fine, more tan than the greenish it appears on screen. I'll definitely order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Deborahann S

customer_reviews.title: My work shoe since 2004
customer_reviews.text: My work shoe since 2004! I haven't calculated how many steps I've taken in Merrell Moabs since February 2004, but at ~10,000/day, 5 days a week, the number is substantial. (Wait, let me do that.... 32.9 million steps total. Several pairs of these shoes, more than 10 pairs. And yes, I'm sitting down right now.) These shoes fit well, hold up well, and can go everywhere I need to go, year-round. The worst thing you can do for yourself is to wear shoes that make you miserable. I like my Moabs, and I like me in my Moabs.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H

customer_reviews.title: Cushy Support
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Merrell's Moab walking shoes. The first pair, which I bought two years ago and have continuously worn most days for dog- walking on trails, is still sturdy, but the puffy inside lining has worn down in places. I'm in heaven every time I slip on my new shoes and feel that cushy support. No rubbing, no callouses, no cramping, no sweating, no blistering. Your feet can stretch out and breathe. I could live in these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. My feet fit either a 9 or a 9 1/2, so I ordered a pair in each size. I thought the smaller size was okay, but found the half size larger to be so much more comfortable. I have worn these hike Zion as well as walking all over the Vega Strip. I have a history of foot issues and won't keep wearing shoes just for their looks. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: First Merrell Sneakers - True Comfort.
customer_reviews.text: First Merrell sneakers are fabulous. I've been wearing Merrell mocs, slides and boots for years but had been nervous changing from tried & true Asics. But oh my, why did I wait so long. I was on my feet all day on the second time wearing, and just like my other Merrell shoes, these shoes provided full support and comfort. And the sale price made it even better. I expect to be wearing these shoes for some time and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: KimmyBird

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my usual size, 9.5, from another vendor and my toes hit the end of the shoe. I ordered a size 10 from Amazon and it fits perfectly. I especially appreciate the room in the toebox since I have arthritic bumps on a couple of toes and am forced to get shoes to accommodate them. Merrell hiking and trail shoes do not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Alice C

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quality tennis shoes
customer_reviews.text: It is a good quality tennis shoes. However, if you need it in less than 11 days, don't buy it. We have Amazon prime but even with that, the item arrived 11 days after we bought it. I bought it for my wife to take on our travel. It arrived 1 day after we left. The package stayed on our yard for 10 days until we got back. I'm not very happy with Amazon prime and I think I won't renew it.
customer_reviews.author: Gig'em

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: HIGH ARCH SUPPORT! Really happy with these shoes. I am an 8 wide so ordered an 8.5 and the fit perfectly. The support they provide my arch is exceptional. Wasn't thrilled with paying almost $200 for shoes but seriously worth every penny. Looking forward to these shoes lasting for years. I had a pair of Salomon shoes that I wore for years. They had a metal bar for support and loved them but after years donated them to a Mexican worker in Arizona, believing she would benefit from wearing such wonderful shoes. The error I made was I could never find anything comparable to those...til now. Fingers crossed. Time, wear & tear will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna 0216

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hikers ever!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable awesome! I know you're not supposed to go backpacking with a new pair of hikers but I had no choice - wow was I pleasantly surprised at how comfortable and well fitting these were. They didn't rub or irritate my feet - and they were sturdy and tough as well. I'm a huge fan of Merrell's barefoot shoes and now their hiking shoes as well! Well done Merrell!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle DeMarco

customer_reviews.title: ... last minute before a backpacking trip and they were perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these last minute before a backpacking trip and they were perfect for the job! The sole is really nice, supportive Vibram rubber with nice blocky tread. The upper is a mixture of mesh and suede, which means it is not waterproof but it's very breathable so if you're not anticipating much water they're great. They got 6 straight weeks of daily use, at least 8 hours a day, on a combination of trails, bush whacking, and rock climbing and are still in great shape. The insole is very comfortable and antimicrobial so you don't get any foot odor in the shoe. I'll definitely get another pair if these ever wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Geo-Ram

customer_reviews.title: Bought for trip to China and it saved me!
customer_reviews.text: Almost three weeks of touring China with a brand new pair of shoes without a break-in period was risky. But these babies PERFORMED. I walked and climbed for hours every day with no rubs, aches, cramps or fatigue. So lightweight I didn’t feel like I even had shoes on. Absolutely the best trip purchase I made.
customer_reviews.author: Book Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes from a reliable company
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes were awesome for a recent one night hiking/camping trip I did in the California mountains. I was able to hike up and down dirt and rocky trails and rock faces with no problem. The footbed was comfortable without needing to replace the insoles. They were comfortable right out the box, no breaking in problems at all, and very light weight. My feet felt stable, protected, and secure. I have pretty flat feet/fallen arches, so really drastic arches in shoes tend to hurt me, and I had no problems. I fit shoes between an 8 1/2 and a 9, and the nines fit great (with wool socks). I have narrow to medium width feet.
customer_reviews.author: S.C. Trojan

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Shoes I've Had So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with my decision to buy these hiking shoes. I plan to do a small portion of the Superior Hiking Trail this September. I generally wear size 9-9.5 in shoes and chose the latter for hiking shoes to fit warmer socks. They fit perfectly and are SO SO comfortable and keep my feet dry. I really love the color as well! I would highly recommend these to anyone looking for a great hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Merrell's Are Usually My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed with these. They are comfortable and grippy so that's good, they are a bit heavy which I expected. The problem is they begin to fall apart after just a few hikes. The material around the lip of the ankle started tearing. These are my 5th pair of Merrells (others are vibrams running shoes), but first pair of hiking shoes. I expected higher quality, so I can't reccomend these.
customer_reviews.author: S. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who can't stand heavy footwear but need a good tread
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking in the woods, over rocks and stumps and pine needles. I needed a good shoe with grip that would also support my ankles, as I tend to roll them on the rocks. I have been wearing this shoe for a year now, and it is very durable and takes me where I need to go. I don't like to wear big clunky heavy shoes....this one is perfect, light, yet durable with a good tread.
customer_reviews.author: Toree

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted/needed
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 6 and this fit perfectly. It is comfortable and provided the proper traction for a very steep hike exploring the trails around Seattle area. I wore a light pair of socks. These shoes didn't rub, didn't have to break in and the color was neutral enough to wear with anything. I have never hiked before so I wasn't really sure what hiking shoes to buy, but based on the reviews here, I purchased this one. I definitely would recommend this pair. I have owned a pair of Merrel sandals before -they are great fitting and very functional. I love that these shoes delivered on both, plus it looks great too, btw.
customer_reviews.author: Jsoloca

customer_reviews.title: Relief for aching heels
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I've tried for work to help with my aching heels. I work in a warehouse on concrete and forklifts for 8 hours and these shoes have helped a lot. I used to hobble around when first getting up from sitting or sleeping, now I rarely have any heel pain. I did add an insert, Dr. Scholl's for sore feet. The inserts have small bumps all over, they seem to stimulate the bottoms of my feet. I feel that these shoes are well made and will last quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: supercriticalgirl

customer_reviews.title: I bought these a half size up which is usually a very comfortable fit but the half size was a pretty big ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried on my normal size in the store and was worried they'd be too tight once I started hiking. I bought these a half size up which is usually a very comfortable fit but the half size was a pretty big difference on my feet. They still fit very nicely around the heel and arch which I need for my trekking but the front is bulkier than I like. They look great on and are super comfortable during my long distance hikes. I like the look of them and really appreciate the Merrell brand for their durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully comfortable. I am wearing them all over NYC ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully comfortable. I am wearing them all over NYC without having to break them in at all. I've had bunion surgery and hammertoe surgery on one foot and a toenail removed on the other foot, so I am very particular about the shoes that I wear. These shoes were perfect from day one. No pressure points, no blisters, no rubbing. Nothing but pure comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda M. Talbutt

customer_reviews.title: Light, breathable and grippy shoes that cause no soreness or strain
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with Lowa hiking boots for years and always ending a hike with blisters, I decided to go with these low-top trail shoes. I've worn these on day hikes and every day during a trip to the Middle East where I was walking on ancient, bumpy cobblestoned streets frequently, and my feet have never even felt tired or blistered one bit. I just bought my second pair because I'm scared to death that Merrell will stop making these shoes which fit me so well!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gray

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of good shoes in my life. Used to work sales/retail. Have back and other pain problems. These shoes provide total support. I feel more balanced when I am walking. Back feeling good. Very stiff the first time I wore them. That is what I need. A few days later, they are fine. Have improved my walk. Don't have to worry about my back. It's using some different muscles. They are thick to provide shock support. After all the bells and whistles-they are so cute!!! Will be "hiking" up a storm this spring and have a feeling they are going to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Crazynana

customer_reviews.title: Fit seemed good, so I ran my errands
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size 9 instead of 8.5 after reading reviews. There is a little room left at the toe of the shoe, but not a problem. No heel slippage. I received these today and immediately started to wear around the house. Fit seemed good, so I ran my errands, to three stores. Great shoes. Very comfortable, very supportive.. would recommend these shoes to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They have a good grip to prevent us from having an accident
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I do retail merchandising work. These shoes are stylish and clean enough to wear with our khaki pants and a polo shirt and still look professional. We work all day in them and our feet never get tired. They have a good grip to prevent us from having an accident. They are reasonably priced and come in so many different colors. Been wearing them for 4 years now and have yet to replace mine. Bought my wife a new pair for Xmas and she was appreciative. We LOVE them and hope they keep making them for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacass

customer_reviews.title: It is a great shoe in that my old pair is the same ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a great shoe in that my old pair is the same brand same style. However my old shoes are a 9 and a half so I ordered a nine and a half and they were way too small. So I reordered them in a 10 and a half and they just barely fit. Why can't the size be consistent?
customer_reviews.author: Lee Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Three season, all terrain hikers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these same hiking boots years ago and completely wore a first pair out. After a few years of wearing no so great alternatives I was happy to order another pair. They are perfect! They fit and feel terrific. Looking forward to many miles of walking in them. The soles protect you from the rocks and roots on trails and they are light enough for regular pavement walking. The "ventilator" aspect is good for three seasons in dry weather. I have warmer waterproof Merrell's for the winter and wet weather. The color is great too. A little more blue than the picture which is fine with me.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Trail or Street - These Shoes Rock!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Bought this second pair before the design changes... Substantial Vibram sole, yet lightweight and comfortable. I bought a half size larger than usual to add flexibility for heavier hiking socks when needed. This turned out to be perfect! The name "ventilator" is so true... my feet seem cooler. Rugged shoe when hiking on rocks, yet comfortable for everyday city use. I have had plantar fasciitis and these shoes have really helped. No pain! Wore the first pair for a month long trip through National Parks and wildlife refuges in December. Since returning, I find them replacing my usual "tennis" shoes for everyday use. Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Carol C

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Women's Moab Ventilator Hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Merrell Women's Moab Ventilator Hiking shoes are the most comfortable shoes I have worn in years. I wear a 7 1/2 in Nike but wear a size 7 in these shoes. I usually wear orthotics with my shoes, but they are not necessary in this shoe. My feet always hurt and I have to take them off for awhile during the day, except with these shoes. I can wear them all day without pain. I know they are called hiking shoes, but to me they look like sneakers but are better. Definitely give them a 5 star. If there was a higher rating...I would add +2
customer_reviews.author: Shoppingmavin

customer_reviews.title: I do have a pair of Merrell suede hiking boots that I love. If these don't work for hiking I can ...
customer_reviews.text: A very comfy shoe. Only problem is my toe on one foot is a little close to the end. One of my feet must be bigger than the other. But I have worn them to work out and my foot doesn't slide around and give me blisters. (a common problem for me) I haven't walked or hiked in them yet so I can't say how that will go. I do have a pair of Merrell suede hiking boots that I love. If these don't work for hiking I can wear my other Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: linda l. cranston

customer_reviews.title: Like Walking on Air
customer_reviews.text: I wear a larger size in Merrells than in other shoes. Before foot problems, my shoe size was 5 1/2. In a Merrell I wear a 6 1/2. These shoes are a dream to wear. Although considered a hiking shoe, I wear them to town for running errands and grocery shopping. They're great for all day wear. I wear orthotics, and the insoles come right out to accommodate the orthotic. These are just the best shoes ever once you find the right size. My first pair are now "yard shoes," and after several years they're a bit scuffed, but I haven't been able to wear them out.
customer_reviews.author: crznszn

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoe with good anti slip soles. My only issue is they are a little too heavy and least for me. My legs get tired when I wear them when working my 2nd job as a bartender. Since I work at a sports stadium I'll now just wear them on rainy days when I need extra grip. Haven't tried them hiking yet but they appear and feel like they'd grip well and would be good for all terrain hikers
customer_reviews.author: KelBake

customer_reviews.title: Too wide
customer_reviews.text: I had another Merrell shoe size 10.5 that I really love, but is finally wearing out, so I bought these Moab ventilators expecting at least a similar fit. They are too wide. I had used the others for regular walking shoes and intended these to be the same. I suppose if I were using thick hiking socks they would have been ok, but in my opinion there is some inconsistency in how Merrell is sizing their shoes. Also they seemed a little too stiff for walking. I ended up buying some Rockports that I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I got these about a week ago for a late spring trip to Machu Picchu based on reviews I had read. So far, I have worn them walking my dog and for a 7000 steps afternoon of museum exhibits and downtown KC walk Very satisfied!! I ordered 1/2 size up per reviews and they fit fine out of the box. They did squeak on tile at first but not after a walk outside. We haven't had any rain since I've had them, so I can't comment on that. Very happy with my purchase at less than list price!
customer_reviews.author: AngieKS

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I have absurdly high arches, the envy of professional dancers kind of arches, so I did add some gel arch supports and - WOW! I LOVE THESE SHOES. The laces, BTW, did not come untied all day while doing steady exertions and movements. And I really love love love the color - SMOKE - as it's the same color as faded denim. Really lovely. Great with jeans. I look forward to hikes in these, too! These shoes give you solid support that becomes invisible, you just don't think about it!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Monfort

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a replacement pair and they fit just like the first pair
customer_reviews.text: As an Intensive care nurse in a very busy hospital, these are the only work shoes I wear. I've tried all brands of tennis shoes and had no foot relief until these. My first pair lasted close to a year with wearing them 4 times a week for 12+ hours per shift. I ordered a replacement pair and they fit just like the first pair. They do take a couple wears to break in and I have to initially tie them much looser until they are broken in otherwise my arches will get a little crampy. But they broke in well after about 80 hours of initial wear.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Crazy about these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for walking 6 miles daily around a hilly campus with a 40 lb backpack. These shoes feel like they're giving my feet a hug! Comfortable, no break-in required. Very wide toe box. Good support - the gentle stride correction makes my leg muscles work in new ways, but my feet, ankles, knees and back feel so much better at the end of the day. Caveat: while I'm anxious to kick off nearly every other shoe each evening when I get home, I'll catch myself still wearing these shoes when I'm ready to go to bed. They feel better than barefoot, something I didn't think was possible.
customer_reviews.author: jenny oh

customer_reviews.title: good arch support was great for a short while then ...
customer_reviews.text: good arch support was great for a short while then behind the heal fell apart so don't expect them to last for long
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!! I'm on my feet 12+ hrs a day at work. I work in construction as a landscape architect and am always in the field. These have proven to be the most comfortable and sturdy shoes. I wear them so much I think I need another pair! I can tell the soles are starting to wear down as my feet have barely started ache after a long day. However they've seen their use and well it's well worth it! The wear on the outer shoe is still great, could last for at least 2 more years. I've also used them hiking and camping and they are awesome there as well. Great grip and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: my favorite hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of these myself (29 y/o female) and I recently ordered a pair for my mom! They're great because they are lightweight and easy to travel with. I also love the grip that the sole of the shoe offers. I ordered the water resistant pair for my mom and now I want to order one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious especially going down steep hills.
customer_reviews.text: I got the shoes to keep me from slipping while hiking. I found them to work better when I had to climb up the hill which is what I wanted. I do get skeptical when going down steep hills because traction not as good but doable. I was just more careful
customer_reviews.author: Oscar and Cyclones mom

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes around our house for a short amount of time before putting them to the test in Colorado. I couldn't be happier with these shoes! I had absolutely NO slipping or sliding issues and no ankle problems. They were tested on several hiking/4 wheeling trails including the famous Black Bear in Telluride, CO. They were comfortable enough and good looking enough to wear when walking around town. I wear in 7 in Nikes and ordered these in a 7.5. My custom orthotics fit well in them as well as heavier socks. LOVE THEM!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Myers

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed wearing the Moab Ventilator for years
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed wearing the Moab Ventilator for years. However, the company has changed the insole. It is now paper thin and perforated at the top, and it feels as though I am walking on concrete. It is terribly uncomfortable at the ball of the foot. I simply cannot wear this shoe as it is now manufactured, and I 'm really not up for spending even more money on a pair of insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Merrell makes the most comfortable hiking shoe for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. Merrell makes the most comfortable hiking shoe for my feet. They have great traction for uneven terrain. I already own several pairs so I already knew my shoe size. These shoes are a bit roomier than most, so if you have narrow feet, they might not fit you as well, but you can always try on a pair at a local REI to get the correct size for your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Weibel

customer_reviews.title: Light hikers.
customer_reviews.text: I owned these shoes years ago and decided to get another pair. These are nice but not the quality they were 10nyr ago. The support cushioning doesn't seem to be as good. The outer shoe is still very durable looking. May have to purchase better insoles as I have plantar fasciitis and heel spurs. Hope to day hike in these.
customer_reviews.author: sherri

customer_reviews.title: I need ankle support
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this boot a 3 is due to no ankle support. I ended up buying the mid-height version of the shoe. The mid- height gives me the ankle support I need. If you don't need ankle support then this shoe will be perfect for you. Merrell makes good boots. It has good traction; comfortable with no break in period; worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Nice style, we like the color scheme -- but it does no good if the shoe doesn't fit. Not even close. What's strange is that, even within the same line of shoes, Merrell's sizings will be different. Wife normally wears an 8.5, 9 at largest so we ordered the 9; not even close to fitting. Probably need to get a 9.5, but who knows, maybe even a 10 -- the 9 in this ventilator is, for some reason, even smaller than the 9 in the waterproof mid. Can't buy shoes again on Amazon because their orders do not arrive on time and we can't spend $1000 at a time playing a guessing game about correct sizes
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W. Gudenius

customer_reviews.title: Need cushon on bottom of feet
customer_reviews.text: I am not as impressed with these as I thought I would be. Wore them around one day, and my feet hurt so bad. Thought it might have been too much for a first wear. Put them on again, and they habe no cushion on the bottom of the feet. This explaining why the bottom of my feet hurt so bad the first wear. Would return, but my window closed. Lessons learned.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fits as described, breathes, comfortable! Wear them for any outside endeavors when walking on uneven ground, as well as for hiking. Wore out one pair and bought another! If this one wears out, am likely to buy a third!
customer_reviews.author: NE

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of the Moab Ventilator Hiking Shoe bought in the past few years and love them. I expected this shoe to be the same, although in a different color (taupe). However, the shoes are a little too large, the cushioning at the ankle is overly thick and bulges away from my ankle, and the shoelaces are so short I can't tie them properly. I'm returning the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: WisLass

customer_reviews.title: No orthotic needed
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. I have morton's neuroma and have to use a special orthotic with almost all of my shoes and boots. I can wear this shoe for hiking without any orthotic. The fit was as expected. Sometimes I need a wider footbed but the medium width was perfect. I wear a 9.5 most often but sometimes a 9 is better. For this shoe, I ordered a 9.5 and that was the right size. I have been practicing in the neighborhood and I am anxious to wear these hiking in Arizona in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I travel for a living and these were perfect for all weather and walking conditions
customer_reviews.text: I travel for a living and these were perfect for all weather and walking conditions. I sprayed them with waterproof spray and that made them even better, and the colours didn't bleed or fade. I bought them for a 20 day trek thru China (Great Wall, Yellow Mountain, Shanghai - to name a few) and walked everywhere like I was on a cloud - no blisters, not chaffing, feet strayed wonderfully dry and they are comfortable even when flying. We were walking about 20,000 - 30,000 steps a day and they held up wonderfully AND I love the colours you can get them in..
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: A+ as always from Merrell and Tactical Ops
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I have been wearing them every day for package deliveries, and they have great traction while protecting my feet from tree debris, (acorns), rocks, etc. The ventilation keeps my feet from getting too hot, and after 6 hours of hustling, my feet don't hurt at the end of the day. The gray/blue colors look great with jeans. I have already ordered a second pair (after 3 weeks) in case they change the color and style - I'd miss them too much! Merrell shoes always keep my feet comfortable and well supported. I am thrilled with my purchase! I bought them via Amazon from Tactical​ Ops. They shipped quickly and were packaged well. Great customer service, too!
customer_reviews.author: Jen STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great quality.
customer_reviews.text: This hiking shoe is amazing and comfortable. Love that these have Vibram soles which makes them that much better. Barely had to break these in out of the box. Comfortable from the first day of use and did not get any blisters. I'd recommend getting a half size larger so your toes aren't pushing on the front of the shoe when hiking and also lets your feet expand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: I like these shoe's generally
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoe's generally. I'll wear them but this purchase the width seems to have expanded. I have a very narrow foot, which is why I was hoping I'd found a shoe I could count on for consistency in size. I have the Merrell Hiking boots and they seem to stay consistent. I hope nothing changes. I do not have the ability to go and shop for shoes so have to count on that consistency. I'll wear them as they are - - I do like the color. The last pair lasted me a good long while and I put a lot of miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: DiJeay

customer_reviews.title: These hiking shoes are the best! I ordered them on my same shoe size
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are the best! I ordered them on my same shoe size. I used them for a couple of days intensively. Even went to Perú's Machu Picchu with them (I did not walk the Inca trail, just the ruins). They are very comfortable. Soles have very good grip. And the arches are their best feature for people like me, with plantar fascitis. Of course, I also bought a good pair of socks specially made for hiking and that also must have help. At the end of those 2 days I didn't feel sore at all.
customer_reviews.author: Thinkerball

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the minute I put them on my feet!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I normally have to wear 2 pair of light socks or a thick pair of socks with boots but these are so comfortable out of the box that all I need are a pair of Peds and I'm good to go for the entire day. They're comfortable and require no break-in period, they're fairly light for what they are, they're flexible so you're not clomping around as with other boots, and there is plenty of room in the toe area. I love them so much I now have them in 3 colors. If you're going to invest in just 1 pair of Merrell shoes, it should be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY MERREL'S
customer_reviews.text: I am using my Merrels for my Winter tracks, new fitness routine ;) along creeks and heavily wooded areas and parks with all kinds of conditions. The support is off the hook, as I have two old knee injuries and broke my ankle several years back. They have proven to handle mud, tree trunks and obstacles along nature's way. Don't have the same spring in my step as a sneaker, but that's not what they're for. I wore them to work, as I'm on my feet alot catering..my feet felt GREAT after a 10 hour shift! Time for a pair in black for work!!
customer_reviews.author: Margee Barth

customer_reviews.title: I love these hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about ordering my usual size after reading some of the reviews, but I put them on and wore them comfortably right out of the box. I use a mid-weight sock with them. I did use them on shorter walks the first few days but never had any problems at all. I wore them on an all day outing yesterday and my feet felt great! This is my first pair of Merrells and I will buy them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: ChristiWB

customer_reviews.title: the shoes are very comfortable, but I haven't worn them on any long ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, the shoes are very comfortable, but I haven't worn them on any long hikes. I bought them for an upcoming trip to Europe, where I expect to do a lot of walking. Right now, I don't know how they would feel if worn for an extended time. I did take the advice of other reviewers and ordered 1/2 size up, and they fit perfectly, with excellent arch support. Fingers crossed they will live up to expectations in London and Paris.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Needed trail shoes for hiking and saw these. Ordered 1/2 size up from my shoe size as I usually do for running shoes and that was spot on. The shoes are quite bulky - perfect for hiking but I could not imagine wearing these to run to the store or as a replacement gym shoe while shopping. They have good ankle support which was lacking when I wore gym shoes to hike and my ankles felt really secure on rocky terrain. They look nice too!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I posted that they're "somewhat small" as I founnd the 9 fits perfectly on my size 8.5 foot. I knew that before ordering, however, as I'd purchase a pair a year or so in a store where I could try them on. That being said, these are the most comfortable pair of shoes I own, so I bought another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but will take some getting used to as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable but will take some getting used to as the sides and tongue are much more bulky than I had anticipated. One tends to brush the ankle area when walking. Will see how the 'breaking in' process goes and if I can get used to the new way of walking. Laces are also short, so short I cannot double knot so will look for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, comfortable, and good quality hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of these hiking shoes. They are comfortable straight out of the box and great for hiking or just everyday walking. Attractive and good quality. I highly recommend these. I hope that Merrell doesn't ever change them because they are my favorite shoe just the way they are!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Yogi

customer_reviews.title: As comfortable as the last pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth pair of ventilator boots in about 15 years. They fit just like my last pair, very little break in time, I expected to get my 1000 miles out of them. I tried the waterproof version and hated them, too heavy. So i wear these in the rain and do not complain. I find them comfortable until its about 75 degrees, I have worn them hiking in Turkey and Italy. I have a wide foot, high arch , narrow heel.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage PowerReader

customer_reviews.title: They were starting to get pretty dirty and their age is showing so I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of this style of Merrell hiking shoes. The older pair is about 3 years old now and they've been all over the south Pacific, Hawaii and all over the U.S. They were starting to get pretty dirty and their age is showing so I purchased a new pair. Right out of the box they fit great, feel wonderful and I wore them all day without any blisters or soreness. Awesome shoes. Perfect for easy hiking and all day walking.
customer_reviews.author: coyotesings

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Tried them on with thin socks. REALLY COMFORTABLE. Have had trouble the past few year finding sneakers that don't hurt my feet. So far, so good. Love the color, feel fabulous from the moment I put them on. I clicked on somewhat large fitting, I normally wear an 8 or8. 5. Ordered an 8.5. The 8 might have been too snug with socks.
customer_reviews.author: Her Royal Majesty

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Since this hiking shoe has a good reputation, I decided to give them a try. (Always a gamble buying shoes without the benefit of trying them on in person). I ordered a half size larger than I normally wear as was recommended, and I am glad I did. Itried hiking in them with just my normal athletic socks on and they felt okay (no exceptional pain), but with my awful feet, I bought some insoles for additional support, and now they feel much better. They are keepers and I can recommend them to anyone. Especially those ladies with normal feet!
customer_reviews.author: kat erickson

customer_reviews.title: Buy these for your next hike!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite hiking shoes I've ever owned! I've traveled over fifty miles in these shoes and only had a few blisters along the way. All of thoes times were because my feet were wet or very sweaty. I wear a phase 4 orthodic insole with them. It does fit loose in the back, but if you do a heel lock it should solve the problem. I will definitely purchase another pair in the future!
customer_reviews.author: True Reviews

customer_reviews.title: They not only fit comfortably but the quality is really great
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I both have Merrell shoes and they are worth every penny. They not only fit comfortably but the quality is really great. Yes, these aren't bargain basement priced but with Merrell you absolutely get what you pay for. If you are on the fence with another (perhaps less expensive brand), make the plunge and invest in serious comfort and quality. We own 5 pairs between my wife and me and love them!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hourihan

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Women's Moab Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Merrell women's shoes provide the best fit for my feet!!! I have Merrell flip flop sandals, casual flats, sneakers and now hiking boots. The Beluga/Lilac color goes with everything. Interestingly enough these hiking boots do NOT look or feel clunky like my old Vasque boots. Merrell's toe box gives just the right amount of room to accommodate any thickness of sock. I usually wear a 7.5, but go up 1/2 size for hiking boots. I bought the Moab Ventilator for hiking Costa Rico's rain forests. It is a light weight, comfortable yet rugged hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: EvergreenGal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit good but the actual weight of them was too much for me. I returned them to the seller and got an immediate credit on my credit card. Great customer service even though I didn't keep the shoes! Well done! :)
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: and these fit great. No heel slippage
customer_reviews.text: I tried several different styles of hiking shoes, and these won hands down. The stability and comfort far surpassed any others. I ordered a 1/2 size up as suggested by other reviews....but didn't need to. I returned and reordered in my regular size. I have a long narrow foot, and these fit great. No heel slippage, and great arch support. Haven't worn them on a long hike yet.....but do not anticipate any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: No more aching feet!
customer_reviews.text: I've found that Merrell's have great arch support, so I always end up going back to their brand. I have arthritis in my feet which makes for sore feet, but have found that with good arch support I can stand and walk much longer without the pain. This is my 3rd pair in the last couple of years. I have tried other brands, but for me these work the best.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerbell

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes because I regularly hike at a mountain near our house--with my regular walking shoes my feet hurt! There are a lot of rocks, roots and such in the path and I needed a more rugged shoe. This Merrell Moab works wonderfully. My feet no longer hurt and I do not slip and slide when the path is wet!! They fit great, I wear a 9.5 and I ordered a 9.5 it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H. Millsaps

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this shoe. This is my second pair of Merrells. I bought them because a co-worker raved on about how great they are. I tried to wear them to work and they are not made to stand in, not for me anyway. I also tried hiking in them and they don't provide enough support for hiking. They are basically a glorified tennis shoe. I don't recommend nor would I buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY A COMFORTABLE HIKING SNEAKER
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard to fit foot and have tried several brands of low cut hiking shoes/sneaker. I returned 2 pairs of Keen low cut hikers because nothing fit right. I finally tried the Merrell's women's low cut Moab Ventilator (in Smoke/blue). The shoes ran true to size with a nice wide and deep toe box while still comfortable in the heel. My orthotics fit in the shoe without any loss of comfort. These shoes are supportive, comfortable and good looking. They grip well whether walking in the city or on trails. I couldn't ask for more and I highly recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: CLB in Syracuse

customer_reviews.title: Shipped on time and broke in quickly. Terrific comfort and support for my moderate hike.
customer_reviews.text: Two days before I was to leave on a road trip to Newfoundland, I discovered my hiking shoes had gone missing. I quickly came to AmazonSmile and did a search. This shoe had high marks. Fortunately, one reviewer mentioned to get a size larger, which I did. The package arrived the next morning and the fit was perfect. They worked perfectly for my hike to Bird Rock at the Cape Saint Mary's Ecological Reserve.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalKate

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable with good support and a good rugged sole for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I use them primarily for hiking in the desert. They feel worn in on day one. Very comfortable with good support and a good rugged sole for trail hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kay Ports

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful shoes, I wanted them for trail hiking so ...
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful shoes, I wanted them for trail hiking so that I don't always have to wear my hiking boots. There is plenty of room for my toes, and the heel is very supportive. I do have to say that it took a few days for my feet and legs to get used to wearing them, but that is what I was expecting. I also purchased them as I wanted a shoe that I could wear to work and around town and these sure fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Nance

customer_reviews.title: Great support for over pronator
customer_reviews.text: I used to go through a pair of cheap walking shoes once every 3 months. I was finally introduced to Merrell shoes and I can keep this shoes for over a year. I have high arches and over pronate, and if I don't wear supportive shoes my ankles and knees start to ache. I have recently bought these as a replacement for similar shoes. I have been walking 2 to 4 miles a day in these shoes and they feel great. I typically wear a size 8.5 to 9 depending on the brand, and Merrell shoes I wear a 9.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, for hiking or just walking without challenges
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, for hiking or just walking without challenges. Traveled immediately after purchase to hike in Utah...Moab, interestingly, and I felt as if I could walk vertically up the side of a rock, they're so well made. I took a half-size larger than I usually take, and that made a great difference, as I had extra room for large hiking socks. I've never had such comfortable shoes that don't seem to be affected by the adverse conditions of hiking in rough terrain. I just love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair exactly like these didn't know if I bought a 6 or 6.5 the first time. Now I know they were a 6, I got a 6.5 this time and they are a little looser. I stand at work most of the day, and have back and hip issues and these shoes were comfortable the first time and lasted over a year. I did try another Merrel shoe but the shoe tracking on the bottom has a circle that pushes on a trigger point on my heal that affects my back. So I searched the net for my first pair. Will again soon so I have a spare pair. A 6 this time
customer_reviews.author: Hmeganc

customer_reviews.title: Another Merrell shoe I love even more than the last pair.
customer_reviews.text: Always hesitant to buy new shoes before a week of heavy hiking in Yosemite... but Merrell's have always fit me well and not seem to need that breaking in period. This was no exception, and the breathability and waterproofing were above and beyond (and both were needed on the hikes).
customer_reviews.author: pp

customer_reviews.title: Favorite travel shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Merrell light hiking shoes. The first pair lasted about 7 years with light use. I find them more comfortable than athletic shoes. These are my go to shoes for travel because they are so comfortable and provide support. I would have preferred that these not have a "color" accent (purple in this case), but all the ladies styles did.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. McW

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect. Shoe is comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I hike and walk a lot. This is my third pair of Moab Ventilators. They are perfect. Shoe is comfortable right out of the box, no break in required. Toe box is the perfect width. I like the vibram sole, it helps prevent ankle turns and stone bruises.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader52

customer_reviews.title: Women's Moab Hiking Shoes Are Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Merrell's Women's Moab Hiking Shoes I have purchased. The first was at the sporting goods store Thanksgiving week last year and I loved them so much that I ordered the exact same pair, but a different color, online recently. I work all day long on hard floors and need a lot of support. I do put an extra insole in the shoes to help with the support but I have to do that with most shoes I wear. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: c. brown

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: my new favorite Merrells. I did order up a half size and glad I did as now I have ample room for my toe length. I have major foot issues so being able to wear these shoes all day is an absolute miracle. I've worn them several times already for hiking on uneven terrain and no issue. No hot spot, not discomfort....just really, really, happy feet.
customer_reviews.author: LuvCO

customer_reviews.title: Great hikers!
customer_reviews.text: I like Merrells. I have wide toes and a narrow heal and they always seem to fit me better than other brands. I take a daily hike of at least 2 miles and sometimes go further on rougher terrain. These are super confy and have held up well so far. I like the way they look too. I will buy again when these need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: kweaz

customer_reviews.title: Up and Down the hill
customer_reviews.text: Needed these for a major hiking event. They came in less time then indicated by the seller....that is always good. Have worn them for several hikes....some short and some major hikes (>10 miles). The fit is good...have lots of room in the toe box and no tightness after several hours hiking. The padding on the bottom is great and I'm able to scramble around both large rocks and small stones without any pain. My only issue is they are warm! This the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5. All in all they are a great shoe and true to size.
customer_reviews.author: cool'n in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seemed extremely well made and we're very attractive. However, I went for a walk to get a feel for them and they hurt my feet so badly I had to turn around after half a mile and go home. Now, I have very flat feet from years of wearing Converse so I should have anticipated the discomfort I experienced. The arches in these shoes are very defined - so if you have healthy, arched feet like a normal human being, it is likely you will find them very comfortable. But if you're flat-footed like me, maybe keep looking for hiking/walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Kalkauski

customer_reviews.title: It's grippy and comfortable enough for light to moderate hiking
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent hiking shoe, however the toe box is very wide so I find my feet slide around when I go downhill, which can make it difficult. It's grippy and comfortable enough for light to moderate hiking, but I think I will shop for something different on my next pair. It took a couple of days to break in, as it bothered my heels initially (I'm used to a more minimalist shoe with less shape), however I don't notice that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sumosha

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and versatile GREAT hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I'm never disappointed with Merrell's products! Comfortable and light weight enough to wear all day - didn't even have to break them in. I previously owned the Moab Ventilator Mid and these are just as great. If you are wanting more ankle support definitely lean toward the Mid, but overall a great versatile hiking shoe. So far they are holding up well, I know my previous pair lasted well over three years and were only replaced because my dog chewed on them.
customer_reviews.author: Kylee Cole

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of feet issues, my children recommended this shoe and it has actually corrected some foot pain I was experiencing. They are very well made and supportive. I use them with orthopedics and can wear them all day comfortably. Have started walking again and believe the shoes have made it possible. They do run small, I usually wear a ten and ordered the ten and a half. Even that was right to my toes so I went up another half size. I also wear a wide, but the medium fits very comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Betty P.

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the color (much nicer than in the photo). Fit well (I ordered a half size larger than my "normal" shoe size). I've gone on three hikes (two of them very steep mountains) and they are comfortable and grip well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marianetti

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these hiking shoes, and actually just use them as an all around sneaker for going out as well as walking the dog. It is a little wide in the toe, but that is fine, I am use to it with my narrow feet, and since I tend to put in my own insoles after a few months, it usually works out best if the shoe is a little bigger to accommodate the insole. The shoes are not heavy or clunky, they are made well and really stabilize my feet so I don't feel like my ankles are rolling. I especially love the color of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Solomon

product_meta.title: Merrell Women's Moab Ventilator Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: Deep lugs and a Vibram sole make for unbeatable grip in this offering from Merrell.
feature_bullets: Synthetic leather toe cap and heel counter
Breathable mesh lining wicks to keep feet dry
Merrell M Select FIT.ECO blended EVA contoured footbed with organic odor control
